norm: It's hurtful to compete with friends for guys.
moral_action: Emma hides her feelings about Tom from Renee and wishes her good luck, deciding it's not worth ruining their friendship over a man.
immoral_action: Emma tells Renee that Tom is also her crush and that she's not going to back down.

norm: It is unusual to prefer obesity in a mate.
moral_action: Sebastian shows Melissa some lower intensity exercises that are good for her fitness level.
immoral_action: Sebastian discourages Melissa  from working out telling her he finds her weight attractive.

norm: It's hurtful to tell kids to find new friends.
moral_action: Landon encourages Eric to spend more time at Dan's house.
immoral_action: Landon tells Eric he needs to find a new friend that is less annoying.

norm: It's horrible to drop kick someone.
moral_action: John files a complaint with his company's HR and Paul is cautioned to be more accomodating.
immoral_action: John gets particularly annoyed with Paul and drop kicks him in anger.

norm: It's terrible to destroy books.
moral_action: Kyle puts a bookmark in the book and brings it over to his friend's house.
immoral_action: Kyle tears the page out of the book, so he can show his friend.

norm: It's unacceptable fight over a cartoon.
moral_action: Delanie waited until the cartoon was over and then asked Darcie if she would like to watch something else.
immoral_action: Delanie changed the channel, which made Darcie very mad and soon they were screaming at each other.

norm: Dog fighting is unacceptable.
moral_action: James takes his dog to a reputable trainer to be trained as a guard dog.
immoral_action: James takes his pitbull to underground dog fighting rings to increase its aggressiveness.

norm: It's absolutely terrible to wish death on anyone.

immoral_action: Benjamin sends the other person violent threats like the ones he received from the other person.

norm: It's good to voice your opinion at meetings.
moral_action: Sandra insists her boss look at her work record and brings out a presentation with examples.
immoral_action: Sandra doesn’t press the issue and picks up extra shifts to earn more money.

norm: It's good to attend a meeting.
moral_action: Joey meets his friends at the bar after the meeting in the office.
immoral_action: Joey skips the office meeting and meets his friends in the bar instead.

norm: It is good to go to job interviews.
moral_action: James went to several job interviews even when he doubted he'd get the job.
immoral_action: James rejected a friend's invitation to a job interview in favor of begging on street corners.

norm: It's good to present a good showing in interviews.
moral_action: James goes to bed at 8 PM and wakes up an hour early to shower and iron his shirt.
immoral_action: James sleeps until thirty minutes before the interview and doesn't have time to shower beforehand.

norm: It's good to tip delivery people.

immoral_action: Maria verbally expresses her gratitude but does not give the driver a tip.

norm: It is good to tip waitresses.

immoral_action: Cam leaves a nasty note on the table for the waitress.

norm: It's good to tip people for their services.
moral_action: When Jack get the bill, he adds on a tip and thanks the server for such a nice dining experience.
immoral_action: When Jack gets the bill, he realizes he is short on cash, so he decides to forego giving the server a tip.

norm: It's gracious to tip a server well.
moral_action: Charles leaves the server a 25% tip on the bill.
immoral_action: "Instead of leaving a tip, Charles writes ""You are blessed"" on the receipt."

norm: Tipping a cashier is nice
moral_action: Kevin pays for the meal with cash and tells the cashier to keep the change.
immoral_action: Kevin hands the cashier exact change for his meal.

norm: It's nice to tip people.
moral_action: Tom decides to pay with his credit card and writes in a tip.
immoral_action: Tom skips out on tipping for the meal service to hold onto enough cash for the store.

norm: It's good to tip people who give you good service
moral_action: Hilary pays for the meal and leaves a big tip for the waiter.
immoral_action: Hilary leaves just enough money to pay for the meal without tipping.

norm: It's polite to tip service people who help you.

immoral_action: Stacy tells the bellhop that she hopes nothing is broken in her bags.

norm: You should give gifts to others.
moral_action: Matt buys Mona a new laptop for her birthday.
immoral_action: Matt gives Mona a birthday card with nothing in it.

norm: You should help others in times of need.

immoral_action: Kevin tells Peter that he actually doesn't have any money at all, even though he has a healthy bank account, and that he can't help.

norm: You should make time for others.

immoral_action: Sara decides to lie to her family about the offer and spends more time with them.

norm: You should offer help if you see somebody needs it

norm: You should be there for others when they need you.

norm: You should do favors for others.

norm: It's to help others when they need some assistance.

immoral_action: Jack speeds on by Phil's car and continues driving along.

norm: You should run errands for people who need help.

immoral_action: Shelly goes to the supermarket and just buys the things she needs personally without considering that her elderly neighbor may need something.

norm: Holdiays are expected to involve other people.

immoral_action: John decides he'd rather just avoid the long drive and stays at home watching Netflix and eating a TV dinner for Thanksgiving.

norm: You're expected to help people when they need it.

immoral_action: Steven calls Anthony up on the phone and asks for help with his roof, and Anthony gives him a price quote.

norm: You should do favors for others when they need it.

immoral_action: Jason tells Paul the furniture looks heavy and walks on.

norm: You should be there for others.

norm: It's considerate to watch someone's back for them.

immoral_action: After agreeing to spot Adam during his workout, Nathan ends up walking away while Adam uses heavy barbells.

norm: It's wise to be aware of the costs of things.
moral_action: After settling on a budget, Dario selects items that fit within her budget.

norm: It is okay to speak up when something is wrong.

immoral_action: Tobias doesn't say anything because he is afraid challenging his bosses advice will leave a bad impression.

norm: It's wise to watch others' reactions when you are uncertain.

norm: It's considerate to watch someone's kids.

norm: It's fun to go to the fair with people.

immoral_action: Jamie buys a ticket online and goes to the fair by himself that evening.

norm: It's good to invite your friends over to play.

immoral_action: Jared insists that he go to his friends house instead of inviting them over to his house, and they hang out.

norm: It's fun to take a cruise with your friends.

norm: It's good to bring your kids to social events.

immoral_action: Chris attends the event alone in order to better control how he is percieved.

norm: It's kind to take pictures for people visiting your town.

norm: It's fun to take your kids to parties.

norm: It's good to invite people to fun events.

norm: It's good to invite your friends to events.

immoral_action: Sarah calls over a random group and tells them to come party with them.

norm: It's rude to invite yourself to someone's house for dinner.

norm: It's rude to offensive at dinner.
moral_action: After finishing his meal, Jason heads to the bathroom to burp.
immoral_action: After finishing his meal, Jason lets out a loud burp.

norm: It's wrong to ruin someone's dinner.
moral_action: Delia adds different herbs and spices to the dinner.
immoral_action: Delia adds a very large dose of chili peppers to the dinner.

norm: It's rude to be late to dinner.

immoral_action: George arrives at the gas station at the time the dinner is starting and shows up after dinner has started.

norm: It's rude to call someone at dinnertime.
moral_action: Gabrielle watches tutorials on fixing toilets on youtube.
immoral_action: Gabrielle calls her roommate several time through the night.

norm: It is rude to interrupt someone's dinner.

immoral_action: Bob calls his friend and asks them the question he has even though he knows that they're probably eating dinner.

norm: It's hurtful to not invite someone to dinner.

immoral_action: Ryan invites all his friends to the dinner except for one.

norm: It's rude to show up late for dinner.

immoral_action: Gordon decides to play one more raid with his friends before meeting his parents at the restaurant, and he ends up not leaving until 7:00.

norm: It is rude to answer the phone during dinner.
moral_action: James ignores the phone but uses the interruption to change the topic of discussion to how telemarketing should be illegal.
immoral_action: James answers the phone and spends ten minutes talking to the telemarketer on the other end to give his family time to finish eating.

norm: It is irresponsible to leave without paying your dinner bill.

immoral_action: Karen grows impatient waiting for the server to bring her bill, so she decides to simply leave without paying.

norm: It's okay to worry about your spouse's health.

immoral_action: Jack ignores his wife's health issues to avoid conflict in the marriage.

norm: It's good to discuss disagreements calmly with your spouse.

immoral_action: Jack scoffs at Jill after she states her preference for a different color than his.

norm: Spending time alone with your husband is romantic.

immoral_action: Jamie makes dinner reservations at a nice restaurant for herself and her husband, but invites Anna along as well.

norm: It's good to get sober for yourself and your kids.

norm: It's good to be honest with your ex.

norm: It's polite to be friendly with an ex-partner.

norm: It is good to encourage your boyfriend to stay sober.

immoral_action: Samantha knowing her boyfriend enjoys drinking, never says anything and starts drinking with him.

norm: It's good to be supportive of people who are sober.

norm: You should never settle for less than you're worth.

immoral_action: Jane is offered the job but does not negotiate her salary and takes one lower than average.

norm: You should not spend more than you make.

immoral_action: Tom buys a new car that is way out of his budget.

norm: You shouldn't buy more than your budget can take.

immoral_action: Roger decides to buy the new boots and worry later.

norm: You should not expect someone to do more than you.

norm: People shouldn't buy more stuff than they can feasibly use.

norm: People shouldn't take more than they need.

immoral_action: Fernando takes an extra plate of food in case he doesn't get enough, then fills up before he can eat it all.

immoral_action: Harold tells his wife that's a great idea and that he can't wait to drive it when they get it.

norm: You shouldn't fail all your classes.

norm: You shouldn't break rules to help a student graduate.

immoral_action: Kent goes to a public meeting about the taxes and vigorously protests them.

norm: You shouldn't discourage your child when they're applying to college.

norm: Taking your wife places contributes to a healthy relationship.

norm: It is good to stay alive to support your daughter.

norm: It's good to be focused on women's health
moral_action: Phil selects a plan that covers women's health concerns as well as mens.

norm: It's good to be faithful to your wife.

norm: It's good to keep the love alive in your marriage.

norm: It's good to help out pregnant people.

norm: You should help out your partner financially.

norm: It's good to help out your partner financially.

immoral_action: Phil tells his girlfriend to borrow some money from her parents or get a second job.

norm: It's good to help out your family financially.

norm: It is expected that you help your family financially sometimes.

immoral_action: Dane spends all of his money on a new television set.

norm: It is good to work to support your family.

norm: It's expected that you will support your friends' businesses.

norm: It's good to help out your family with chores.
